v.v: Then Elihu continued by saying this:
“You men who think that you are very wise, listen to me;
When we hear people talk,
We must decide who is saying what is right,
Job has said, ‘I am innocent,
Even though I have always done what is right,
Is there any person like Job, who insults others as easily as people accept a drink of water?
He habitually associates with people who do what is evil
He certainly does these things, because he has said, ‘It is useless for people to try to please God.’
So, you men who claim that you understand everything, listen to me!
He pays back people for what they have done;
Truly, Almighty God never does what is wicked;
No one gave him the authority to rule everything on the earth;
If he ever thought only about himself and not about us also, and if he ever stopped making us live,
everyone would die immediately,
So, Job, if you say that you understand everything,
God could certainly never hate was is right and still rule the world.
He tells some kings that they are worthless,
He does not favor rulers more than he favors others;
They often die suddenly;
He sees everything that people do;
There is no gloom or darkness
God does not need to set a time
He destroys important people without needing to investigate what they have done,
Because he already knows what they have done,
He strikes them because of the wicked things that they have done;
He strikes them down because they turned away from doing what he wanted them to do
They mistreated poor people;
Yet even if God decides to do nothing to punish wicked people,
He does this so that those who rule over us may honor him,
Job, have you or anyone else ever said to God, ‘I have certainly committed sin,
so teach me what sins I have committed;
Job, you object to what God has done to you,
People who have good sense, those who are wise and who listen to what I say,
‘Job is speaking ignorantly;
To you friends of Job, I say this: I think that a court should thoroughly try Job,
To add to the other sins that he has committed, he is rebelling against God;
